abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Cocoa Rehabilitation Project in
            Cameroon. The key objective of the Cocoa Rehabilitation
            Project was to overcome the stagnation in cocoa output and
            expand cocoa export earnings by helping modernize the cocoa
            industry. Smallholder incomes and Government tax revenue
            were expected to improve as a result. The project resulted
            in no measurable increase of cocoa production or yields. The
            Bank's performance was marginally satisfactory at
            identification and preparation. Bank performance at
            appraisal was unsatisfactory as there is no indication that
            the lessons of the previous project, which had cost twice as
            much as expected for no measurable results, were taken into
            consideration. Borrower performance was satisfactory at
            preparation but poor at implementation. The project's
            overall rating is unsatisfactory. There are four main
            lessons to be learned from this project: (a) Project
            preparation should include an in-depth review of all aspects
            of the project, including an assessment of the executing
            agency, political and other vested interests, stakeholder
            commitments and the Borrower's and beneficiaries'
            ability to pay. (b) Privatizing inputs supply will not
            generate a private sector response in the absence of
            sufficient price incentives to use these inputs. (c)
            Progress in achieving the project's development
            objectives should be continually reviewed and where it is
            clear that they are no longer achievable, alternatives need
            to be considered (redesigning the project or closing it).
            (d) Macro-economic conditions, and more especially the value
            of the exchange rate, are critical for the success of a
            number of agricultural operations, particularly those
            dealing with exports.
